alert.note: Alert for Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 5:18PM CST until December 17 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN STONE AND NORTHWESTERN TANEY COUNTIES... At 518 PM CST, Emergency management and spotters reported flash flooding occuring in the Branson area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods, Rockaway Beach and Indian Point. This includes the following low water crossings... Roark Creek at Expressway Lane, Trigger Creek at Highway J, Stout Creek at Hulls Ford Road, Caney Creek at Caney Creek RD and Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
